snippet: From unemployment claims to payrolls and job openings, the labor market is becoming robust, even as economic growth has slowed in recent months.
abstract: Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits fell 21,000 to seasonally adjusted 283,000 for week ended Feb 14.
lead_paragraph: From unemployment claims to payrolls and job openings, the labor market is becoming robust, even as economic growth has slowed in recent months.

headline.main: Jobless Claims Fall as U.S. Economy Gains Strength
headline.print_headline: Weekly Jobless Claims Fall as Economy Strengthens
